thread.title: Jose Mourinho backs Schweinsteiger and Fellaini to fill void left by injured stars in Manchester United's EFL Cup final
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho backs Schweinsteiger and Fellaini to fill void left by injured stars in Manchester United's EFL Cup final

author: Jake Polden
title: Jose Mourinho backs Schweinsteiger and Fellaini to fill void left by injured stars in Manchester United's EFL Cup final
text:
Sport Jose Mourinho backs Schweinsteiger and Fellaini to fill void left by injured stars in Manchester United's EFL Cup final The Portuguese said the final will be complicated without the duo but admitted it is an opportunity for others to step in Share Jose Mourinho has backed Bastian Schweinsteiger and Marouane Fellaini (Photo: Christopher Lee) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho has backed Bastian Schweinsteiger and Marouane Fellaini to fill the void left behind by the injured duo Michael Carrick and Henrikh Mkhitaryan in the EFL Cup final. 
The Manchester United pair picked up knocks in their side's 4-0 aggregate win over St Etienne in the second leg of their Europa League last 16 tie on Wednesday. 
Mkhitaryan, who scored the only goal of the encounter, hobbled off with an apparent hamstring injury in just 25 minutes and was replaced by Marcus Rashford. 
While Carrick suffered a calf injury and made way for Schweinsteiger with half-an-hour of the game left to play. Schweinsteiger in action in United's 1-0 over St Etienne (Photo: REUTERS) 
Mourinho all but ruled the duo out of the EFL Cup final against Southampton on Sunday, but is confident Schweinsteiger and Fellaini can step up to the plate and fill the void. 
On the Armenian's injury, Mourinho said: "You can be injured leaving the house or in the garden, you never know when or why, it's the result of so many matches. 
"You have the risk of it but at the same time when someone is missing it's an opportunity for another one. Mourinho has given Fellaini a vote of confidence ahead of Sunday (Photo: REUTERS) 
"Obviously they are important players for us and not to have them both for the final is complicated. 
"But I think Marouane [Fellaini] and Bastian [Schweinsteiger] - two players who are normally not playing too much - is a good answer. 
"I don't say they are definitely out. I just say what I feel. Hamstring or calf, I always think three days is no time." poll loading Will Manchester United win the Europa League this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
